commit_message:
tripleo: update scenarios

scenario002 to run zaqar and scenario003 to run mistral.
So it reflects our desire to keep consistent with Puppet OpenStack
scenarios.

Change-Id: I755d3dde517ad5e2706db4645d40bfcf856c4f14

commit_message:
Fix 'ImportError' when docbuild.

There is not module 'messaging.utils' in 'watcher.common'
but module 'synchronization' instead.

Change-Id: If2d585a4f416614cbe91e4ef61fc7473508d38af
Closes-Bug: #1643862

commit_message:
Avoid some redundant db operations

There are some redundant db operations in stack actions.
This change mainly includes:
1. only update the stack_user_project_id in _create_stack_user()
2. avoid to delete and set same tags if unneccesary

Change-Id: I6e972a2c988605d802475aee6810019b1a109a05

commit_message:
Add project Octavia to OpenStack big-tent

This involves merging neutron-lbaas into the Octavia
project and migrating Octavia out of the neutron stadium, making
Octavia the Load Balancing As A Service (LBaaS) project for
OpenStack. Specs for exactly how this is going to happen are
linked as depends-on. The 'neutron-lbaas' repo will exist during
the transition, and eventually be retired with no impact on
operators/end users beyond packaging.

Change-Id: Ia807a5ad36859a0228aed76c307a97dec8494b7c
Depends-On: I5303b04ec2ca5acd525d9b5137f012515a8dc1df
Depends-On: I9bc348c6f86f868ec5e9ab2be2ae49947bfbacdc

commit_message:
heat.template parameter and group

Creates new python package heat.template and moves
parameters and parameter_groups from engine into
this new module.

implements blueprint python-heat-template

Change-Id: Iaea9a0bb0e9b3a4242097d710c03c594b9bdabe5

commit_message:
Improve performance of stack filtering

Now we do only one call to db instead of two: one that loads
all resources and another that filter resources.

Change-Id: Ia4d8f05ac52057d3f8c674fbb7d3650fd08cdceb

commit_message:
Replace deprecated oslo messaging config

Using 'rpc_backend' in 'DEFAULT' group, and 'rabbit_hosts', 'rabbit_password',
'rabbit_userid' from 'oslo_messaging_rabbit' group are deprecated from
oslo_messaging. We turn to use oslo.messaging.drivers and transport_url
config instead.

Depends-On: I32250da3832a80afc5c8ba2d01fd188a652c3af8

Change-Id: I3a5541dbb749372e69cda73407aa4becf6a95425
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/325606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: conf = conf.oslo_messaging_rabbit return 'amqp://%s:%s@%s:%s/' % (conf.rabbit_userid, conf.rabbit_password, conf.rabbit_host, conf.rabbit_port)

commit_message:
Handle nested stacks in resource search

In previous implementation we mistakenly iterate over filtered
resource list, so we miss some stack-like resources and do not
try to find resources in corresponding nested stack. We should
care about all nested stacks that satisfy max_depth condition.
Also we should return empty list if there is no resources that
matches request instead of NotFound.
Note that this change is acceptable according to api-wg
evaluating_api_changes: "Fixing a bug so that a request which
resulted in an error response before is now successful."  thoug
may seem backward-incompatible.

Change-Id: Ieb31f2d53a4a5f680e0af6864237ccccc1ada3e7
Closes-Bug: #1569296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/38/304538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: return [api.format_stack_resource(resource, detail=with_detail) for resource in filter_type(stack.iter_resources(depth, filters=filters))]

This change modifies the handle_update method to look at the delta in the security group rule set and only affect changes.  Rules that are not in the target rule-set will be removed and new rules will be added, but unaffected rules will be left alone.

commit_message:
Improves SecurityGroup update handling for changes to rules.

When running stack update to make changes to rules in
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup, Heat will delete all the rules and then
recreate them based on the updated rule-set.  This can be disruptive to
instances that are members of the security group during the period between
removing rules and re-instating.

This change modifies the handle_update method to look at the delta in the
security group rule set and only affect changes.  Rules that are not in
the target rule-set will be removed and new rules will be added, but
unaffected rules will be left alone.
The change still caters for the default egress rules
  * adding them if no specific egress rule exists
  * deleting them if they exist and a new specific egress rule is added
    in the update.

Change-Id: I8874acbdcd342797ff55918f3eb1069fcb8c8798
Closes-Bug: #1582596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/66/317466/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _rule_is_in(self, rule, rule_list): for idx, r in enumerate(rule_list): for attrib in r.keys(): if str(r[attrib]) != str(rule[attrib]): # compare failed for this rule - stop comparing attributes break else: return idx return None def _is_default_rule(self, rule): return (rule[self.RULE_DIRECTION] == 'egress' and (rule[self.RULE_ETHERTYPE] == "IPv4" or rule[self.RULE_ETHERTYPE] == "IPv6") and rule[self.RULE_PORT_RANGE_MIN] is None and rule[self.RULE_PORT_RANGE_MAX] is None and rule[self.RULE_PROTOCOL] is None and rule[self.RULE_REMOTE_GROUP_ID] is None and rule[self.RULE_REMOTE_IP_PREFIX] is None) def _add_rules(self, rules): for i in rules: rule = self._format_rule(i) try: self.client().create_security_group_rule( {'security_group_rule': rule}) except Exception as ex: if not self.client_plugin().is_conflict(ex): raise def _update_rules(self, update_rules): try: sec = self.client().show_security_group( self.resource_id)['security_group'] except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) else: has_egress = False existing_default_rules = [] rules_to_delete = list(sec['security_group_rules']) # reduce lists to delta set of rules # also track egress rules to know if default egress set is needed for rule in sec['security_group_rules']: idx = self._rule_is_in(rule, update_rules) if idx is not None: if not has_egress: has_egress = rule[self.RULE_DIRECTION] == 'egress' rules_to_delete.remove(rule) update_rules.pop(idx) # remove existing rules not in target set for rule in rules_to_delete: # default egress rules are handled later if self._is_default_rule(rule): existing_default_rules.append(rule) else: try: self.client().delete_security_group_rule(rule['id']) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) # add new rules not found in existing set for rule in update_rules: try: if not has_egress: has_egress = rule[self.RULE_DIRECTION] == 'egress' self.client().create_security_group_rule( {'security_group_rule': rule}) except Exception as ex: if not self.client_plugin().is_conflict(ex): raise # handle requirement of default egress rules if has_egress: # default egress rules not used when explicit egress rule exist for rule in existing_default_rules: try: self.client().delete_security_group_rule(rule['id']) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) else: # Add default egress rules if not existing if not existing_default_rules: self._add_rules(self.default_egress_rules) # * determining delta in ruleset # * delete removed rules # * add new rules # * restoring the default egress rules, if required update_rules = [] for i in rules: update_rules.append(self._format_rule(i)) self._update_rules(update_rules)
deleted_lines: # * deleting all rules # * restoring the default egress rules # * creating new rules self._delete_rules() self._create_rules(self.default_egress_rules) self._create_rules(rules)

commit_message:
Handle detach volume without attatched to any instance

Due to RPC timeout during attach call from cinder api
to cinder-volume, the volume may become in-use even
though nova fails the attach operation. The detach will
fail in this case, we need to detach the volumes by
calling cinder api to clean up such in-use volumes.

Change-Id: I3048a627c25a14109fa9b61554f55d9645d2a981
Closes-Bug: #1566300

commit_message:
Modify import style in code

This patch changed some codes which imported objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I0364bc96fd2832adc059156f02407f05a7a9c014

commit_message:
Convergence: Implement Stack Lifecycle Plugpoint

As is the case for the legacy engine, pre-ops and post-ops lifecycle plugpoints
will be executed now for all stack actions with convergence_engine switched on.

The only difference here is that care should be taken by the developers to make
the lifecycle plugin operations idempotent for convergence engines as the user
is now allowed to make concurrent updates to the stack.

Change-Id: Iadaa4b63841d1f4584afa3d2ab87a428129ace0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/75/264675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine.resources.openstack.magnum import service from heat.engine import scheduler from heat.tests import common from heat.tests import utils magnum_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2015-04-30 resources: test_service: type: OS::Magnum::Service properties: bay: 5d12f6fd-a196-4bf0-ae4c-1f639a523a52 manifest_url: file:///a/b.json ''' RESOURCE_TYPE = 'OS::Magnum::Service' class TestMagnumService(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestMagnumService, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() resource._register_class(RESOURCE_TYPE, service.Service) t = template_format.parse(magnum_template) self.stack = utils.parse_stack(t) resource_defns = self.stack.t.resource_definitions(self.stack) self.rsrc_defn = resource_defns['test_service'] self.client = mock.Mock() self.patchobject(service.Service, 'client', return_value=self.client) def _create_resource(self, name, snippet, stack): self.resource_id = '12345' self.test_service = self.stack['test_service'] value = mock.MagicMock(uuid=self.resource_id) self.client.services.create.return_value = value svc = service.Service(name, snippet, stack) scheduler.TaskRunner(svc.create)() return svc def test_bay_model_create(self): svc = self._create_resource('svc', self.rsrc_defn, self.stack) self.assertEqual(self.resource_id, svc.resource_id) self.assertEqual((svc.CREATE, svc.COMPLETE), svc.state)

commit_message:
Improve glance image _show_resource

There are two problems in logic of image _show_resource:
1. the version condition-check makes no sense, because
the version is exactly '1.0' if using self.glance(), so we
won't enter 'else' block.
2. if user specify 'tags' when create image, there is no way to
show the attribute 'tags' info.

This changes the two problems aboved:
1. get common attributes from glancev1
2. get 'tags' info from glancev2 if user specify 'tags'

Change-Id: Ia62192a4352dd522709724abbbc655ce09568315
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/23/334423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # use glancev1 to get common attributes dict attrs = super(GlanceImage, self)._show_resource() tags = None import pdb pdb.set_trace() if self.properties.get(self.TAGS) is not None: # get tags from glancev2 image-get response v2_attrs = self.client(version='2').images.get(self.resource_id) tags = v2_attrs.get(self.TAGS) if tags is not None: attrs[self.TAGS] = tags return attrs
deleted_lines: if self.glance().version == 1.0: return super(GlanceImage, self)._show_resource() else: image = self.glance().images.get(self.resource_id) return dict(image)

commit_message:
Fix validate in neutron resources

Due to overriding of 'get_reference_id'
method in Neutron base resource, we can get
an empty string value in properties which are
set with function like get_resource or get_attribute
during validation.
This patch corrects some validation checks to handle
such situations.
Also, minor fix in subnet's L348.

Change-Id: I54646fe1eeaa5c9ad23567f596ad330bc10e35da

commit_message:
Add timeout for software/structured deployments

After the timeout is reached, the deployment will be marked as failed.
If the timeout is specified for a SoftwareDeploymentGroup, it will be
added to each deployment resource in the group.

Change-Id: I20f13659bb2dc84757c9aadd333eb94ad6810796
Closes-Bug: #1557764

commit_message:
Allow configuration of a maximum batch size for the task scheduler

When running tasks in the scheduler, we used to simply start or step as many
tasks as we could before sleeping and then beginning again. When many
resources are in progress in parallel this can result in many API calls
executing in quick succession (i.e. without any intervening sleep), with
the result that we can hit quota limits. To prevent this, allow the
operator to configure a maximum number of resources that can be operated on
between sleeps.

Since creating resources is the most likely thing to cause problems, once
we hit the batch size limit on tasks to start, we prefer polling existing
tasks to starting new tasks. This will tend to limit the rate at which
resources get created in proportion to how long they take to create.

The current default is to maintain the existing behaviour; in future we
will likely want to tune this.

Change-Id: I50182d39a8e5bd479afb6662d080ca15e0b83fe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/23/301323/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Migrate nova_instance to physical_resource_id in db schema

In resource table, nova_instance column is renamed to
physical_resource_id as it is appropriate.

This patch enables the migration of the column and after
3 release from newton, nova_instance column could be
completed removed from the schema.

while reading, it reads from nova_instance otherwise
from physical_resource_id. while writing both the columns
get updated. This logic will help to remove the old
column in p release.

Change-Id: Ibd0dedfc068734cf0653041b9b839b1de5cc004f
Partial-bug: #1346742
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/02/317302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not update keystone group if no args provided

If we doesn't pass args into groups.update() keystone will raise
BadRequest. Do not call update() if there is no expected args.

Change-Id: I73f59bb3ea83b79bf8cb5ff6513c76cf6861c371
Closes-Bug: #1572256

commit_message:
Add periods input parameter

This patch set adds new periods strategy input
parameter that allows to specify the time length of
statistic aggregation.

Change-Id: Id6c7900e7b909b0b325281c4038e07dc695847a1

subject: Fix status reason in events for deployment signals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 08:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/de37599361b3df2bc6219522ec5e746d2c001ec1', 'message': "Fix status reason in events for deployment signals

When a signal is received and processed by a Resource, there could be an
event generated automatically. For such an event, Heat is supposed to
provide some useful message (including status_reason).  But currently,
the resource code can only process ceilometer alarms and watch rules,
for signals sent for a SoftwareDeployment resource, the signal is only
providing an string 'Unknown' as the status change reason.  This is
confusing when a user performs 'heat event-list stack'.

This patch adds an additional check whether the signal comes
from a SoftwareDeployment.  In that case, fill show the status
reason as 'deployment succeeded', or 'deployment failed (n)', where n is
the deploy_status_code that comes with the signal.

Change-Id: I79eed1af1a4b2a57fb6ef3586b1c892145dcbf65
Closes-Bug: #1564627
"}]
commit_message:
Fix status reason in events for deployment signals

When a signal is received and processed by a Resource, there could be an
event generated automatically. For such an event, Heat is supposed to
provide some useful message (including status_reason).  But currently,
the resource code can only process ceilometer alarms and watch rules,
for signals sent for a SoftwareDeployment resource, the signal is only
providing an string 'Unknown' as the status change reason.  This is
confusing when a user performs 'heat event-list stack'.

This patch adds an additional check whether the signal comes
from a SoftwareDeployment.  In that case, fill show the status
reason as 'deployment succeeded', or 'deployment failed (n)', where n is
the deploy_status_code that comes with the signal.

Change-Id: I79eed1af1a4b2a57fb6ef3586b1c892145dcbf65
Closes-Bug: #1564627
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/20/315420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif 'deploy_status_code' in details: # this is for SoftwareDeployment if details['deploy_status_code'] == 0: return 'deployment succeeded' else: return ('deployment failed ' '(%(deploy_status_code)s)' % details)

commit_message:
Silent service status report

Currently, service engine periodically yields a status report into log
as 'info'. This is pretty annoying. We already have error report for
service death and info for service engine start. This patch proposes
making such a report as debug level.

Change-Id: I2938f205e7119a2ce42952438e7311c38cf09c9a

commit_message:
Pre-create port in heat for server with network

In current master code internal portt create only if we set
subnet property. Create internal port for network property too.

Change-Id: I58baccb125c591de66d838442ff681e73aee12dc

commit_message:
Allow attach multiple nics for instance in asg

1. Define the keys for property "NetworkInterfaces",
and according to the docs of the aws, user can specify
"SubnetId", "NetworkInterfaceId" and "DeviceIndex" properties
for each network interface.
2. Refactor the _build_nics() method for aws instance resource,
allow user to specify subnets list to associate with the instance.
3. If user specify property "VPCZoneIdentifier" for aws autoscaling
group, to make the network interfaces for each members in group.

Change-Id: I8f34476bcae7f7c4b57262d66ef7920b78b8a8d2
Closes-Bug: #1476087

commit_message:
Includes project info while admin getting stacks

To return the information of project when super admin
getting stacks across tenants.

Change-Id: I40c0d61325752428b3ccf57706a825b47ae231c9
Closes-Bug: #1641812

commit_message:
Add functional test for retrieving a stack environment

Note that this relies on a client release to add the necessary call [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269179/

Change-Id: I92e1381f7c7bb4e773f06198bb9da54f43270cba
Implements: blueprint environment-show

commit_message:
Add test for stack cancel update

This test will create a stack, update it and cancel 
the update. It then verifies that it is in 
'ROLLBACK_COMPLETE' or 'ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS' state

Change-Id: I2810071122e2260db40e1516b28b7306f103c592
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/88/270488/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import timetest_template_wait_after_update = { 'heat_template_version': '2013-05-23', 'description': 'Test template for canceling update.', 'resources': { 'test1': { 'type': 'OS::Heat::TestResource', 'properties': { 'value': 'TestOriginal', 'action_wait_secs': {'update': 60} } } } } def test_cancel_stack_update(self): # Create a basic stack that has a high wait time for an update stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template=test_template_wait_after_update) # Update the stack tmpl_update = _change_rsrc_properties( test_template_wait_after_update, ['test1'], {'value': 'TestUpdateCancel'}) self.client.stacks.update( stack_id=stack_identifier, template=tmpl_update ) time.sleep(10) # Cancel stack update self.client.actions.cancel_update(stack_identifier) time.sleep(10) # Ensure template is the original one template_after_update = self.client.stacks.template(stack_identifier) self.assertEqual( template_after_update['resources']['test1']['properties']['value'], 'TestOriginal') # Check status is in ROLLBACK_COMPLETE state stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) self.assertIn(stack.stack_status, ['ROLLBACK_COMPLETE', 'ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS'])

commit_message:
Fix for region selection of keystone V2

Heat doesn't selects multiple region for Keystone V2
Setting the default region name through this patch.

Change-Id: Ib9a985ad4ac2763557e404080c4db864ed63c36e
Closes-bug: #1362016

commit_message:
Skip integration tests when test run is external

Some particular integration tests can only succeed if the tests
are being run locally on the same node Heat is running,
but sometimes it might be useful to have ability to run these tests against
an already deployed remote Heat to validate its functionality.

This patch adds a new integration tests config option "external_test_run"
(defaults to False) and gives ability skip particular tests
if it is set to True.

Notification, reload on SIGHUP and purge deleted stacks tests
are marked as such outright.

Change-Id: I41ec69009e1e1c49d801e8855c8d3ed0505d8d94

commit_message:
Inherit SwiftSignal behavior from WaitCondition

This change refactors the SwiftSignal and SwiftSignalHandle resources
to inherit all the signalling logic from WaitCondition and
WaitConditionHandle respectively. As part of this change, the format
of the signal metadata in all wait conditions has been changed from a
dictionary to a list, so that the order in which signals were fired
can be preserved.

Change-Id: I7d0a3f6a9b5baedd08216ffd7a1189af4293a98c
Implements: blueprint uniform-resource-signals

commit_message:
Cleanup old resources if they have been replaced

Cleanup old resources if they have been replaced, even if
the deletion_policy is 'Retain'.
This patch set the deletion_policy to 'Delete' for resources
when cleanup them if they have been replaced.

Change-Id: Ia1f6edfe2a0640c71385ea98afe536f97292666c
Closes-Bug: #1553088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/11/290311/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete(self, deletion_policy=None): deletion_policy = (deletion_policy if deletion_policy else self.t.deletion_policy()) def destroy(self, deletion_policy=None): yield self.delete(deletion_policy)
deleted_lines: def delete(self): deletion_policy = self.t.deletion_policy() def destroy(self): yield self.delete()

subject: Catch all exceptions to move stack to UPDATE_FAILED
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-28 02:15:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/61baaf2ba891e35c9ef43b6127413817506747ae', 'message': 'Catch all exceptions to make sure move stack to FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.
This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I40214bd5dc5b16b3d9c4c0936516b0b3098b081c
Closes-Bug: #1492433

CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to

commit_message:
Catch all exceptions to move stack to UPDATE_FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I40214bd5dc5b16b3d9c4c0936516b0b3098b081c
Partial-Bug: #1492433

added_lines: def test_update_unexpected_error(self): tmpl = {'HeatTemplateFormatVersion': '2012-12-12', 'Resources': { 'AResource': {'Type': 'ResWithComplexPropsAndAttrs'}}} self.stack = stack.Stack(self.ctx, 'update_unexpected_error', template.Template(tmpl)) self.stack.store() self.stack.create() self.assertEqual((stack.Stack.CREATE, stack.Stack.COMPLETE), self.stack.state) tmpl2 = {'HeatTemplateFormatVersion': '2012-12-12', 'Resources': { 'AResource': {'Type': 'ResWithComplexPropsAndAttrs', 'Properties': { 'a_string': 'not_allow_update'}}}} updated_stack = stack.Stack(self.ctx, 'updated_stack', template.Template(tmpl2)) mock_create = self.patchobject( generic_rsrc.ResWithComplexPropsAndAttrs, 'prepare_for_replace', side_effect=Exception('unexpected_error')) self.stack.update(updated_stack) self.assertEqual((stack.Stack.UPDATE, stack.Stack.FAILED), self.stack.state) self.assertEqual('unexpected_error', self.stack.status_reason) mock_create.assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Add Resource Notifications to Heat

Currently only Stack Notifications are supported. However, to
enable more granular analysis of usage data from heat, we require
resource notifications as well.

Change-Id: I033b863959279bda59b302a6bb5f6c2953ff5327
Implements: blueprint resource-notifications
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/246556/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine.notification import resource as notification self._send_notification_and_add_event( self.action, self.status, _("%(a)s paused until Hook %(h)s is cleared") % {'a': action, 'h': hook}, hook=hook) self._send_notification_and_add_event( "Failure occurred while waiting.", hook=hook) def _send_notification_and_add_event(self, action, status, reason, hook=None, signal=None): notification.send(self, hook, signal) self._send_notification_and_add_event(action, status, reason) def _signal_check_action(self, details): if self.action in self.no_signal_actions: self._send_notification_and_add_event( self.action, self.status, 'Cannot signal resource during %s' % self.action, signal=details) self._send_notification_and_add_event( self.action, self.status, "Hook %s is cleared" % hook, hook=hook) self._send_notification_and_add_event( 'SIGNAL', self.status, reason_string, signal=details) self._signal_check_action(details)
deleted_lines: self._add_event(self.action, self.status, _("%(a)s paused until Hook %(h)s is cleared") % {'a': action, 'h': hook}) self._add_event( "Failure occurred while waiting.") def _add_event(self, action, status, reason): self._add_event(action, status, reason) def _signal_check_action(self): if self.action in self.no_signal_actions: self._add_event(self.action, self.status, 'Cannot signal resource during %s' % self.action) self._add_event(self.action, self.status, "Hook %s is cleared" % hook) self._add_event('SIGNAL', self.status, reason_string) self._signal_check_action()

commit_message:
Power off node in oneview

Recently the following problem raised: in order to deploy
a node, OneView driver strongly requires to power off the
node just before calling set_boot_device.
Therefore the method for now is lazily applying boot device
and power off the node only when it is needed, so that it is
supposed to be consistent with other user's behaviour.

Took into account removing 'vendor passthru' cleanup in
OneView deploy driver.

Change-Id: Iaa35e795e046acc676c2699949d768c8bd2bfa6c
Closes-Bug: #1503855

commit_message:
Fix invalid tests.

The expected and actual values being compared were the same object. These tests
should have been failing.

Pass a shallow copy of the params to the mock (test now fails). Add the
missing params to get it passing again.

Change-Id: Ie986c3d28082c587c11fd6f0b031b23bb102157d

Add get_live_state implementation to mistral workflow

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/79/277979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
raw_definition = """ create_vm: input: [image, name, flavor] output: {vm_id: <% $.vm_id %>} task-defaults: on-error: [on_error] tasks: check_server_exists: action: nova.servers_get server=<% $.vm_id %> on-success: [list_machines] publish: {server_exists: true} create_server: action: 'nova.servers_create name=<% $.name %> image=<% $.image %>
 flavor=<% $.flavor %>

' on-success: [check_server_exists] publish: {vm_id: <% $.create_server.id %>} list_machines: action: nova.servers_list on-success: [wait_instance] publish: {-list_servers: <% $.list_machines %>} on_error: {action: std.echo output="output"} wait_instance: action: nova.servers_find id=<% $.vm_id_new %> status='ACTIVE' keep-result: false pause-before: true retry: {count: 15, delay: 5} target: test timeout: 11 wait-after: 8 wait-before: 7 with-items: vm_id_new in <% $.list_servers %> type: direct version: '2.0' """ def test_mistral_workflow_live_state(self): tmpl = template_format.parse(workflow_template_full) stack = utils.parse_stack(tmpl) rsrc_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack)['create_vm'] wf = workflow.Workflow('create_vm', rsrc_defns, stack) self.mistral.workflows.create.return_value = [ FakeWorkflow('create_vm')] scheduler.TaskRunner(wf.create)() raw_data = {'definition': raw_definition, 'name': 'create_vm'} live_res_data = wf.parse_live_resource_data(wf.properties, raw_data) self.assertEqual(dict(wf.properties.items()), live_res_data)

commit_message:
Use reauth context instead of stored context if enable reauth

Two points after this patch:
1. Create a new context which inherits all roles
of req.context to operate current actions(create/update)
if enable reauth.
2. Stored context is still used for deferred
actions(such as resource signal).

Change-Id: I9fa4fd42223bcd671157c5c0c1ba54bb36261091
Closes-Bug: #1529354

commit_message:
Store the raw, unparsed template in heat

Currently, only a parsed version of the template is stored in the
database. As a result, any comments that the user may have supplied
are lost. Storing the unparsed version of the template will remedy
this by allowing us to show the original version of the template
used to create a stack in a call to 'get template'.

Change-Id: I2d6e317cd6fbfc83b1c83a73c1de905f699b763f
Implements: blueprint store-raw-template

commit_message:
WIP: Add flavor discovery as option

Instead of creating a flavor with admin rights the flavor
resource can be also used to discover an existing flavor.

Co-Authored-By: Marc Koderer <marc@koderer.com>

Support glance image sharing with projects

Support to share image with projects, and also
can specify whether allow the specified projects to
share the image.

added_lines: DISK_FORMAT, CONTAINER_FORMAT, LOCATION, MEMBERS, 'disk_format', 'container_format', 'location', 'members', ) _MEMBERS_KEYS = ( PROJECT_ID, CAN_SHARE, ) = ( 'project_id', 'can_share', MEMBERS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('Share the image with those projects.'), update_allowed=True, default=[], support_status=support.SupportStatus(version='5.0.0'), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, schema={ PROJECT_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The project id to add as member.'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.project') ], required=True, ), CAN_SHARE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.BOOLEAN, _('Whether allow the specified project to ' 'share this image.'), default=False, ), } ) ), def _add_image_members(self, members): for member in members: self.glance().image_members.create( self.resource_id, member[self.PROJECT_ID], member[self.CAN_SHARE]) self._add_image_members(self.properties[self.MEMBERS]) def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): if self.MEMBERS in prop_diff: # first to remove the old members old_members = self.glance().image_members.list( image=self.resource_id)['members'] for member in old_members: self.glance().image_members.delete(self.resource_id, member['member_id']) # second to add new members self._add_image_members(prop_diff.get(self.MEMBERS))

added_lines: ================================= Outlet Temperature Based Strategy ================================= Synopsis -------- **display name**: ``outlet_temperature`` **goal**: ``thermal_optimization`` Outlem(Exhaust Air) temperature is a new thermal telemetry which can be used to measure the server's thermal/workload status. This strategy makes decisions to migrate workloads to the servers with good thermal condition (lowest outlet temperature) when the outlet temperature of source servers reach a configurable threshold. Requirements ------------ Metrics ******* The *outlet_temperature* strategy requires the following metrics: ===================================== ============ ======= ======= metric service name plugins comment ===================================== ============ ======= ======= hardware.ipmi.node.outlet_temperature ceilometer_ none ===================================== ============ ======= ======= .. _ceilometer: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/telemetry-measurements.html#openstack-compute .. _monasca: https://github.com/openstack/monasca-agent/blob/master/docs/Libvirt.md .. _kwapi: https://kwapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html Cluster data model ****************** Default Watcher's Compute cluster data model: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.model.collector.nova.NovaClusterDataModelCollector Actions ******* Default Watcher's actions: .. list-table:: :widths: 30 30 :header-rows: 1 * - action - description * - ``migration`` - .. watcher-term:: watcher.applier.actions.migration.Migrate * - ``change_nova_service_state`` - .. watcher-term:: watcher.applier.actions.change_nova_service_state.ChangeNovaServiceStat e Planner ******* Default Watcher's planner: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.planner.default.DefaultPlanner Configuration ------------- If your strategy use configurable parameters, explain here how to tune them. Efficacy Indicator ------------------ .. watcher-func:: :format: literal_block watcher.decision_engine.goal.efficacy.specs.ServerConsolidation.get_global_efficacy_indicator How to use it ? --------------- .. code-block:: shell $ openstack optimize audittemplate create \ at1 thermal_optimization --strategy outlet_temperature $ openstack optimize audit create -a at1 External Links -------------- None.

commit_message:
Support snapshot/restore for StackResources

This change will support snapshot and restore for
'OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup' resource.
1. Add 'snapshot_id' property for the resource.
2. Call rpc api 'stack_snapshot' to snapshot for
nested_stack of the StackResource.
3. Update the StackResource's template with property
'snapshot_id'.
4. Call rpc api 'stack_restore' to restore the
nested_stack when updating.

Blueprint: snapshot-restore-stackresource

Change-Id: I0785fa7c79ba5e235baeababbe8e99e3a28e02ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/58/213658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine import function from heat.engine import propertiesfrom heat.engine import support # snapshot id for stack resource INTERNAL_PROPERTIES = ( SNAPSHOT_ID ) = ( 'snapshot_id' ) internal_properties_schema = { SNAPSHOT_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Snapshot for StackResource, it is an internal property ' 'which is used only for restore StackResource.'), update_allowed=True, support_status=support.SupportStatus(version='5.0.0'), ) } def handle_snapshot(self): nested_stack = self.nested() if nested_stack is None: raise exception.Error(_('Cannot snapshot %s, stack not created') % self.name) stack_identity = nested_stack.identifier() snapshot = self.rpc_client().stack_snapshot(self.context, stack_identity, None) self.data_set('snapshot_id', snapshot['id']) def check_snapshot_complete(self, cookie=None): return self._check_status_complete(resource.Resource.SNAPSHOT) def handle_restore(self, defn, restore_data): snapshot_id = restore_data['resource_data']['snapshot_id'] props = function.resolve(self.properties.data) props[self.SNAPSHOT_ID] = snapshot_id return defn.freeze(properties=props) def update_for_restore(self): stack_identity = identifier.HeatIdentifier( self.context.tenant_id, self.physical_resource_name(), self.resource_id) updater = self.rpc_client().stack_restore( self.context, stack_identity, self.properties[self.SNAPSHOT_ID]) checker = scheduler.TaskRunner(self._check_restore_complete, updater) checker(timeout=self.stack.timeout_secs()) def _check_restore_complete(self, updater): while not self.check_restore_complete(updater): yield def check_restore_complete(self, cookie=None): return self._check_status_complete( parser.Stack.RESTORE, cookie=cookie) def prepare_abandon(self): abandon_data = self.nested().prepare_abandon() abandon_data['resource_data'] = self.data() return abandon_data

commit_message:
Enable abandon option to nested resource

Resources use abandon_in_progress option for abandoning in
prepare_abandon method. When abandon_in_progress, resource's
deletion policy is "Retain" and resource will not delete. Nested
resource prepare_abandon missed enabling that option, so all nested
stacks delete.

Change-Id: I819566e4e1ca81193c745dcdd89217f31db41b07
Closes-bug: #1509912
(cherry picked from commit 103a09bc1c3e9f2e4894bba19963ca91b6652155)

commit_message:
Pass user/project domain id to ceilometer client

Init local request context with user/project domain infos

Set user/project domain id from req.headers while
init local request context. Then we can use them if needed.

Pass user/project domain id as `user_domain_id/project_domain_id`
to ceilometer client.

Change-Id: Ibbd363dc1d2e56fda98a5bd158a403c2f0941e85
Co-Authored-By: Rabi Mishra <ramishra@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1529058
(cherry picked from commit 5eec4c080f5a4dd7fc81eaeba9a734427c789255
and 378bcde62764e1271445354fedc57d982985ea0c)

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: Ia2ebe625d8a757f2ec1c38a321b5de3c676c57f0

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Idcce59c7cb84f205b589486fcdbc779f13053b9f

subject: devstack: tempest CI fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 04:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/post_test_hook.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/8de834f615ec04b2c3408bf7d31e16091761f203', 'message': 'devstack: tempest CI fails

With devstack update of changeset of
21d84c29b22fb69b00739ae40d69f80d5182a94e
change id of I9f1d7e58b861b04473b6a57c9ad404203fb7277a
causes tempest CI failure.
It checks if the plugin is already enabled, and if so, it exits with
error.
Since stackrc sources localrc, "source localrc; sourced stackrc" in
post_test_hook.sh causes enabling networking-odl twice.
Avoid source localrc in order to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ibde74add0b42f4f05c5f6b77a8b66e31e85c4123
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: tempest CI fails

With devstack update of changeset of
21d84c29b22fb69b00739ae40d69f80d5182a94e
change id of I9f1d7e58b861b04473b6a57c9ad404203fb7277a
causes tempest CI failure.
It checks if the plugin is already enabled, and if so, it exits with
error.
Since stackrc sources localrc, "source localrc; sourced stackrc" in
post_test_hook.sh causes enabling networking-odl twice.
Avoid source localrc in order to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ibde74add0b42f4f05c5f6b77a8b66e31e85c4123
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/30/404530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines:
{% set scriptdir = '../../common/js/' %} {% set cssdir = '../../common/css/' %} {% extends "templates/base.tmpl" %} {% block pagetitle %}Newton Installation Tutorials and Guides{% endblock %} {% block title %} Documentation > Newton Installation Tutorials and Guides {% endblock %} {% block content %}

Newton Installation Tutorials and Guides

The following tutorials and guides support basic installation of core and optional OpenStack services on variants of Debian with debconf, Debian, Red Hat, SUSE, and Ubuntu distributions. A minimal deployment necessary to launch a simple instance (VM) requires following the core content. Optional content augments a minimal deployment with additional services.

By distribution

Debian 8 with debconf Debian 8 openSUSE Leap 42.2 And SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP2 Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and CentOS 7 Ubuntu 16.04

By chapter

Abstract ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Conventions ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Overview ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Environment (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Identity service (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Image service (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Compute service (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Networking service (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Dashboard (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Block Storage service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Shared File Systems service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Object Storage service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Orchestration service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Telemetry Data Collection service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Telemetry Alarming services (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Database service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Container Infrastructure Management service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Messaging service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Key Manager service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Bare Metal service (Optional) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Launch an instance (Basic) ( Debconf, Debian, SUSE, RDO, Ubuntu)

Documentation treated like code, powered by the community - interested?

How To Contribute

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE

This patch has to demonstrate performance improvements of
py27/py34/finctional job because of this oslo.policy patch:
I43782d245d7652ba69613b26fe598ac79ec19929

oslo.policy is a library. So to apply and test this patch
I forked oslo.policy project, upload the patch into forked
repository and added dependency in test-requirements.txt

Depends-On: If0e00b83f9b7660c15b363199dc42f0a09cd63e5

commit_message:
Allow parameter duplication in parameter groups

We currently have a restriction that a valid paramater
can only be part of one parameter group. It would be
useful to remove that restriction for new hot template
versions.

Change-Id: Icb64b44c0d490ad02dbe74bcbe8f6d09c8a729fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/40/356240/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters = tmpl.parameters(None, {}, param_defaults={}) if parameters: self.parameter_names = [param for param in parameters]
deleted_lines: self.tmpl = tmpl self.parameters = tmpl.parameters(None, {}, param_defaults={}) if self.parameters: self.parameter_names = [param for param in self.parameters] grouped_parameters = [] # Check if param has been added to a previous group if param in grouped_parameters: raise exception.StackValidationFailed( error=_('Parameter Groups error'), path=[PARAMETER_GROUPS, group.get('label', '')], message=_( 'The %s parameter must be assigned to one ' 'parameter group only.') % param) else: grouped_parameters.append(param)

Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).

This explicitly converts the deleted flag to an integer (which will

commit_message:
Never pass boolean deleted to instance_create()

This explicitly converts the deleted flag to an integer (which will
always be zero) at Instance.create() time. We already require it to
be False, but if set, we will pass the boolean instead of an integer,
which will confuse some (self-respecting) DBMs.

Change-Id: I67a340eea79b4423e77a00242ec6ae345e8c0e19
Closes-Bug: #1644513

commit_message:
(fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run

The latest set of changes to devstack include one
where enabling a plugin more than once now causes
a fatal error.  Trovestack code sources openrc,
which sources other files that eventually call
enable_plugin on the trove module.  Unfortunately
since trovestack also sources some of the same
files, this causes the error to be triggered.

The fix is to remove the call to openrc and just
set the credentials manually.

Change-Id: Iec71474ccfe757c8384c0b4e4b0758636668aebe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/27/404527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local credentials="--os-username=admin --os-password=$ADMIN_PASSWORD --os-tenant-name=admin --os-auth-url=$TROVE_AUTH_ENDPOINT --os-region $REGION_NAME" TOKEN=$(openstack $credentials token issue | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) GLANCE_IMAGEIDS=$(glance $credentials image-list | grep $(basename $IMAGE_URL .qcow2) | get_field 1) glance $credentials image-delete $GLANCE_IMAGEIDS
deleted_lines: # The devstack openrc has references to 'enable_plugin' which causes errors # in the stable/juno and stable/kilo branches. These are safe to ignore. set +e; source $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/openrc admin admin; set -e TOKEN=$(openstack token issue | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) GLANCE_IMAGEIDS=$(glance image-list | grep $(basename $IMAGE_URL .qcow2) | get_field 1) glance image-delete $GLANCE_IMAGEIDS set +e; source $PATH_DEVSTACK_SRC/openrc demo demo; set -e

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/cbe501ce6fdb04d2909beee48c928063\n'

Change-Id: Ifec1e95e95a9501e2d44c0c51990ae34870a9198

commit_message:
Support server group(part1)

Currently nova_apigw in the Tricircle doesn't support server
group[1], so we can't enforce affinity or anti-affinity policy
when creating VMs.

This patch adds server group support to the Tricircle. A server
group controller handling CRUD operations is implemented in
nova_apigw.

Server group controller will not create bottom server group when
handling server group creation. Bottom server group is created
during VM creation, like how we handle network, subnet, port
resources. Bottom server group creation will be implemented
in next patch.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#os-server-groups-v2.1

Change-Id: I0a1330e421a1b3c4b9d4d57d03bac1ac5fdede22

commit_message:
Add resource_affinit_tag to the pod table

1. What is the problem?
In dynamic pod binding[1], the Tricircle needs to bind a tenant to a pod
which provisions a specific type of resources based on the  extra-spec.
Hence, each pod should be attached with a resource_affinity_tag, so that
the Tricircle can select all the pods whose resource_affinity_tag
matches the extra_spec tag.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
To facilitate selecting available pods which provision a type of
resources, we add a new column named resource_affinity_tag to the pod
table in this patch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No extra features needs to be implemented in this patch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tricircle/blob/master/specs/dynamic-pod-binding.rst

Change-Id: Idc5628dbed3a86b53a3e1b7f77f14c5a90b95359

in lvm.py "LOG.warning(_LI" should be "LOG.warning(_LW"

commit_message:
[install] Remove chrony repositories on obs

The chrony package is included in the standard Leap 42.2 and SLES-12-SP2
repositories. It is not necessary anymore to add a special repository.

backport: newton
Change-Id: I94495209e12237eff5e5f26e56785173289e0494
(cherry picked from commit b6291c1ec80e5d61b36eda634a57777bfddee264)

commit_message:
Perform package install outside of debootstrap

Debootstrap only supports one apt repository to install packages from.
As a result, we do not consider the updates repo during debootstrap
causing us install a second kernel when we do an apt-get dist-upgrade
during build.

Lets use debootstrap to get us a minimal chroot, then add our repos and
install the correct packages from the start.

We also have to reorder the dpkg root.d scripts which configure apt so
they run before we perform our package installs.

Change-Id: I6a592db6f0a01d3b19d8e0786e63f1315a1ef647
Closes-Bug: #1637516

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR=${DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR:-http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu} # We should manage this in a betterer way sudo bash -c "cat << EOF >$TARGET_ROOT/etc/apt/sources.list deb $DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR $DIB_RELEASE main restricted universe deb $DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR $DIB_RELEASE-updates main restricted universe deb $DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR $DIB_RELEASE-backports main restricted universe deb $DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR $DIB_RELEASE-security main restricted universe EOF" sudo mount -t proc none $TARGET_ROOT/proc sudo mount -t sysfs none $TARGET_ROOT/sys trap "sudo umount $TARGET_ROOT/proc; sudo umount $TARGET_ROOT/sys" EXIT apt_get="chroot $TARGET_ROOT /usr/bin/apt-get" # Need to update to retrieve the signed Release file sudo $apt_get update sudo $apt_get clean sudo $apt_get dist-upgrade -y sudo $apt_get install python sudo

Kolla supports add plugin to horizon and neutron-server images now,
but it doesn't support add plugin to keystone image.
In some scenarios, it is necessary to add customized identity
authentication plugin to keystone image.
For example:in our project, the plugin inherits from keystone's
Passowrd plugin, using Password plugin to authenticate first, if fail,
call our self's authentication system to verify. Naturally, we also
add hybrid logic to this plugin, first query from mysql and second
query from ldap if want to query one user detail info.

Please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuration.html#authentication-plugins

commit_message:
Support adding customized plugin to keystone image

Kolla supports adding plugin to horizon and neutron-server images now,
but it doesn't support adding plugin to keystone image.

As keystone itself supports adding authentication plugins, there is a
good chance that user may implement their own plugins for keystone
authentication and identity. It would be better that kolla supports
adding plugin for keystone image just the way like horizon and neutron-server.

Change-Id: Id75c387668c6277efae05b59063f226843aa2a25
Closes-Bug: #1644133

Support fuzzy filtering for the list API of Plan

Fuzzy filtering can be supported by the name and description
fields of the plan list API

added_lines: exact_match_filter_names = ['project_id', 'status'] query = _list_common_process_exact_filter(models.Plan, query, filters, exact_match_filter_names) regex_match_filter_names = ['name', 'description'] query = _list_common_process_regex_filter(models.Plan, query, filters, regex_match_filter_names)
deleted_lines: from sqlalchemy import or_from sqlalchemy.orm import RelationshipProperty """Common filter processing for Plan queries. Filter values that are in lists, tuples, or sets cause an 'IN' operator to be used, while exact matching ('==' operator) is used for other values. A 'metadata' filter key must correspond to a dictionary value of metadata key-value pairs. :param query: Model query to use :param filters: dictionary of filters :returns: updated query or None """ filters = filters.copy() # Apply exact match filters for everything else, ensure that the # filter value exists on the model for key in filters.keys(): # metadata is unique, must be a dict if key == 'resources': if not isinstance(filters[key], dict): LOG.debug("'metadata' filter value is not valid.") return None continue try: column_attr = getattr(models.Plan, key) # Do not allow relationship properties since those require # schema specific knowledge prop = getattr(column_attr, 'property') if isinstance(prop, RelationshipProperty): LOG.debug(("'%s' filter key is not valid, " "it maps to a relationship."), key) return None except AttributeError: LOG.debug("'%s' filter key is not valid.", key) return None # Holds the simple exact matches filter_dict = {} # Iterate over all filters, special case the filter if necessary for key, value in filters.items(): if key == 'resources': col_attr = getattr(models.Plan, 'continue') for k, v in value.items(): query = query.filter(or_(col_attr.any(key=k, value=v))) elif isinstance(value, (list, tuple, set, frozenset)): # Looking for values in a list; apply to query directly column_attr = getattr(models.Plan, key) query = query.filter(column_attr.in_(value)) else: # OK, simple exact match; save for later filter_dict[key] = value # Apply simple exact matches if filter_dict: query = query.filter_by(**filter_dict)

commit_message:
Improve checksum performance for images

Do md5 and sha256 in parallel to speed things up for larger images.

Change-Id: Ib782fe54e4286ba2749a7ab7247f5d41a887a370
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Gather up common isa_l function to isa_l_common.c file

After copy/pasting almost code from isa_l_rs_vand.c to isa_l_rs_cauchy.c,
I'm realizing to wonder why I didn't make the common functions as the base
funcitonalities.

This is my current answer, we can make isa_l_common.c file for common
fucntions like encode/decode/reconstruct. That is because the difference
between isa_l_rs_vand and isa_l_cauchy is just a function entry point for
matrix generation and it will be loaded by dlsym from .so file. Hence,
what we need is just *init* to define what function from isa_l library used
in the backend and attach it to the descriptor in the init function for
each backend.

Change-Id: I453d99a9866f54f20dac72cf76666d39fb2e7e87

commit_message:
Minor encrypt/decrypt unittest refactor

Move encrypt/decrypt functions out of
DBAPICryptParamsPropsTest._test_db_encrypt_decrypt(). This makes it
less complex in the eyes of pep8, which will benefit a future commit.

Also simplify: do not need to pass around template_ids.

Change-Id: I772a3cefc6cccf06990409d7ff8aa3db64f21e6b

commit_message:
add byteorder information and logic to ring files

On-disk, serialized ring files are byteorder dependent, which makes then
unportable between different endian architectures. Add a field to the
ring dictionary in the file indicating the byteorder used to generate
the file, and then byteswap if necessary when deserializing the file.

This patch only allows newly created ring files to be byteoder
agnostic. Previously generated ring files will still fail on different
endian architectures, and will need to be regenerated with this patch.

Change-Id: I23b5e0a8082b30ca257aeb1fab03ab74e6f0b2d4
Closes-Bug: #1639980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/37/395237/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The latter allows us to probably detect # byteswapped data from files generated before the 'byteorder' # field was added. if byteswap or (max(part2dev) > len(ring_dict['devs']) and max(part2dev) == 256): part2dev.byteswap() ring_dict['replica2part2dev_id'].append(part2dev) 'replica_count': len(ring['replica2part2dev_id']), 'byteorder': sys.byteorder})

commit_message:
cors: update default configuration

Set_defaults has been added into oslo_middleware. so we use it
to override the configuration defaults.

Change-Id: I3958be85ef88bc2f99213f070551c259197ae3c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/51/393051/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
